intro: Erlangea monticola, commonly known as the mountain erlang, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, waxy surface. Erlangea monticola thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous forests.
